middle of a race, and they are overall unreliable.

request a full refund. Please also confirm that the baseplate delivery,
which has not arrived yet, will be cancelled so that I will not be charged
for it.

Best regards,
Tamino Hilkenbach
Order #SSN2717

Hi Tamino,     Please use the SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1 download link. We will release an updated version very soon.  In version 2.1.1, follow these steps:    Click Revert    Then click Save    Replug the USB cable    This will disable the Rx axis input that was previously reserved for the brake. Hi Tamino,   If you experience frequent USB disconnections, it's very likely that the USB port cannot provide sufficient voltage and current for the ProX Ultra lighting system.  Here’s what you can do:    Plug the pedals directly into a USB 3.0 port (blue port) on the back of your PC instead of using a USB hub.    Try turning off all lighting effects. If the disconnection issue disappears, it confirms that the problem is caused by insufficient USB power supply.    Please note:    The ProX Ultra LED strips require around 400-800mA in total, while a typical USB 2.0 port only supplies up to 500mA, which is insufficient.       only supplies up to 500mA, which is insufficient.  The issue is even more likely to occur if multiple devices are connected to the same USB hub.

Hi Tamino,    I’m not entirely sure whether your pedals were shipped from our EU warehouse or from China. However, if you choose to return them, the high international shipping costs would far exceed the value of the pedals themselves, which means they could only be scrapped locally. Our pedals are produced with very low profit margins, and our goal has always been to provide the best possible value for money.     From our experience, this issue is not necessarily caused by the pedals themselves. If there truly were frequent disconnection problems, our after-sales team would have already identified and fixed them. In fact, we have encountered many similar cases, and almost all of them were due to insufficient USB power supply from the customer’s PC. With some adjustments—such as switching to a rear USB 3.0 port or using a powered USB hub—the issue is usually resolved.     We sincerely hope to work with you to troubleshoot and solve this issue, rather than going through the return process, which would cause us significant losses and unnecessary inconvenience for you as well.
